newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit rangebound despite weak dollar/majors.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit rangebound despite weak dollar/majors.

text.p: * Ringgit bound to range on selling pressure from funds
* Strong dollar buy orders seen at 2.5090
The ringgit was in a range, but expected to ease slightly on sustained selling pressure from overseas funds, dealers said on Monday.
They said the selling in the thin market was exaggerating the impact on the ringgit, despite weak dollar/majors.
"I believe funds are still on the (dollar) buy side. That is why dollar/ringgit is not going down, even though dollar/majors are softer," said a dealer with a European bank in Singapore.
He said there was demand for dollars at 2.5090 level.
Dealers said the upside for dollar/ringgit would be limited at 2.5140/50 level on demand for ringgit from Malaysia.
"The market is very quiet. Very little volume is going through, probably because it is holiday in Sydney," said a dealer with a Malaysian bank.
At 0245 GMT, the ringgit was at 2.5113/23 a dollar.
